Package io.github.ai4ci.functions

Interface EmpiricalKernel

All Superinterfaces:
KernelFunction, Serializable
@Immutable public interface EmpiricalKernel extends Serializable, KernelFunction
An empirical kernel function.

This interface describes a kernel function defined by a set of discrete points. It includes methods to compute the minimum and maximum x values, and to construct an interpolator for the points. The interpolator is used to compute the raw value of the kernel at any given x.

Author:
Rob Challen

    getSum, value, values

  • Method Details

    • getInterpolator

      @Derived default Interpolator getInterpolator()
      Constructs an interpolator for the kernel function based on the x and y values.

      This method creates a Coordinates object from the x and y values, and then constructs a cubic spline interpolator using the SplineInterpolator. The interpolator can be used to compute the raw value of the kernel at any given x.

      Note: The choice of cubic spline interpolation is a design decision; other interpolation methods could be used depending on the desired properties of the kernel function.

      Returns:
      an interpolator for the kernel function based on the x and y values.

    • getLink

      @Default default LinkFunction getLink()
      The link function applied to the y values.

      This function is used to transform the y values before interpolation. The default is LinkFunction.NONE, which means no transformation is applied. Other link functions can be used to model different types of relationships between x and y, such as logarithmic or logistic links.

      Returns:
      the link function applied to the y values, defaulting to NONE.

    • getMaximum

      @Default default int getMaximum()
      Computes the maximum x value of the kernel function.

      This method computes the maximum by streaming the x values and finding the maximum. It returns 0 if the array is empty, but in practice the array should contain valid x values for a meaningful kernel function.

      Specified by:
      getMaximum in interface KernelFunction
      Returns:
      the maximum x value of the kernel function, or 0 if the array is empty.

    • getMinimum

      @Default default int getMinimum()
      Computes the minimum x value of the kernel function.

      This method computes the minimum by streaming the x values and finding the minimum. It returns 0 if the array is empty, but in practice the array should contain valid x values for a meaningful kernel function.

      Specified by:
      getMinimum in interface KernelFunction
      Returns:
      the minimum x value of the kernel function, or 0 if the array is empty.

    • getT

      int[] getT()
      The x values of the kernel function.

      These values are used to construct the interpolator and to compute the minimum and maximum x values. They should be provided in ascending order for consistency, but the implementation will handle unsorted input.

      Returns:
      an array of integers representing the x values of the kernel function.

    • getY

      double[] getY()
      The y values of the kernel function.

      These values are used to construct the interpolator. They should correspond to the x values in getT() and be of the same length.

      Returns:
      an array of doubles representing the y values of the kernel function.

    • rawValue

      default double rawValue(int x)
      Computes the raw value of the kernel function at a given x.

      This method uses the interpolator to compute the value at x, and then applies the inverse of the link function to transform it back to the original scale. The result is the raw value of the kernel function at x.

      Specified by:
      rawValue in interface KernelFunction
      Parameters:
      x - the input value for which to compute the kernel function
      Returns:
      the raw value of the kernel function at x
